subject: Communication
title: Negotiation Styles: East vs. West
description: A quick win: understand Negotiation Styles: East vs. West.

hook.text: American negotiators flew to Beijing, presented their offer, and expected a deal in one meeting.

buildup.text: Western negotiation is transactional: focus on the deal, minimize relationship talk, move fast.

discovery.text: In China, the relationship IS the contract. In the US, the contract IS the relationship.

twist.text: American impatience is read as disrespect in Asia. Asian patience is read as stalling in America.

climax.text: The best cross-cultural negotiators adjust their pace, not their goals. Building trust costs time but saves deals.

punchline.text: Fast deals aren't always good. Good deals aren't always fast.

quiz.question: How do Eastern negotiation styles differ from Western ones?
options: Eastern styles prioritize relationship-building before deals
